documents.title: Entity Relationship Diagram
documents.content: erDiagram RISK ||--o{ CONTROL : "mitigated by" CONTROL ||--|{ ASSESSMENT : "evaluated in" RISK }|--|| TAXONOMY : "categorized by" ASSESSMENT ||--o{ FINDING : contains RISK { string id PK string description int severity date created_at } CONTROL { string id PK string name string type boolean active }

documents.title: State Diagram
documents.content: stateDiagram-v2 [*] --> Draft Draft --> Review: Submit Review --> Approved: Accept Review --> Draft: Reject Approved --> Active: Publish Active --> Archived: Archive Archived --> [*] state Review { [*] --> Pending Pending --> InReview: Assign Reviewer InReview --> Complete: Review Done }

documents.title: Class Diagram
documents.content: classDiagram class RiskEvent { +String id +String type +int severity +Date timestamp +assess() +escalate() } class Control { +String id +String name +Boolean active +evaluate() } class Assessment { +String id +String status +create() +complete() } RiskEvent "1" --> "*" Control : mitigated by Control "1" --> "*" Assessment : evaluated in

Some advanced features may require specific Mermaid versions. Check the Mermaid documentation for syntax details. :::

documents.title: Math Rendering Test
documents.content: Testing KaTeX math rendering capabilities

documents.title: Math Rendering with KaTeX
documents.content: This page demonstrates mathematical formula rendering using KaTeX.

documents.title: Inline Math
documents.content: The quadratic formula is $x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}$ which solves $ax^2 + bx + c = 0$. Einstein's famous equation $E = mc^2$ relates energy and mass. The probability of event A given B is $P(A|B) = \frac{P(B|A) \cdot P(A)}{P(B)}$.

documents.title: Gaussian Distribution
documents.content: The probability density function of the normal distribution: $$ f(x) = \frac{1}{\sigma\sqrt{2\pi}} e^{-\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{x-\mu}{\sigma}\right)^2} $$

documents.title: Summation Notation
documents.content: Expected loss calculation: $$ EL = \sum_{i=1}^{n} PD_i \times LGD_i \times EAD_i $$

documents.title: Integration
documents.content: The cumulative distribution function: $$ F(x) = \int_{-\infty}^{x} f(t) , dt $$

documents.title: Risk Correlation Matrix
documents.content: $$ \mathbf{R} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & \rho_{12} & \rho_{13} \ \rho_{21} & 1 & \rho_{23} \ \rho_{31} & \rho_{32} & 1 \end{pmatrix} $$

documents.title: Covariance Matrix
documents.content: $$ \Sigma = \begin{bmatrix} \sigma_1^2 & \sigma_{12} & \cdots & \sigma_{1n} \ \sigma_{21} & \sigma_2^2 & \cdots & \sigma_{2n} \ \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \ \sigma_{n1} & \sigma_{n2} & \cdots & \sigma_n^2 \end{bmatrix} $$

documents.title: Greek Letters
documents.content: Symbol Meaning Formula $\alpha$ Significance level $P(\text{Type I error}) = \alpha$ $\beta$ Beta coefficient $\beta = \frac{Cov(r_i, r_m)}{Var(r_m)}$ $\sigma$ Standard deviation $\sigma = \sqrt{Var(X)}$ $\mu$ Mean $\mu = E[X]$ $\lambda$ Rate parameter $P(X=k) = \frac{\lambda^k e^{-\lambda}}{k!}$

documents.title: Value at Risk (VaR)
documents.content: $$ VaR_\alpha(X) = \inf{x \in \mathbb{R} : P(X \leq x) \geq \alpha} $$

documents.title: Black-Scholes Formula
documents.content: $$ C(S,t) = N(d_1)S - N(d_2)Ke^{-r(T-t)} $$ where: $$ d_1 = \frac{\ln(S/K) + (r + \sigma^2/2)(T-t)}{\sigma\sqrt{T-t}} $$ $$ d_2 = d_1 - \sigma\sqrt{T-t} $$

documents.title: Capital Allocation
documents.content: $$ RC_i = \frac{MC_i}{\sum_{j=1}^{n} MC_j} \times EC $$ Where: $RC_i$ = Risk capital allocated to unit $i$ $MC_i$ = Marginal contribution of unit $i$ $EC$ = Total economic capital :::tip KaTeX vs MathJax KaTeX renders math much faster than MathJax and supports most LaTeX math commands. For unsupported commands, refer to the KaTeX documentation. :::

Use it for important context. ::: :::warning This is a warning admonition. Use it for potential issues. ::: :::danger This is a danger admonition. Use it for critical warnings. :::

documents.title: Code Syntax Highlighting
documents.content: This page demonstrates code block rendering with syntax highlighting for various languages.

documents.title: TypeScript
documents.content: interface RiskEntity { id: string; name: string; category: 'operational' | 'compliance' | 'strategic'; severity: number; createdAt: Date; } async function fetchRiskEntities( filters?: Partial<RiskEntity> ): Promise<RiskEntity[]> { const params = new URLSearchParams(); if (filters?.category) { params.set('category', filters.category); } const response = await fetch(`/api/risks?${params}`); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error(`HTTP error! status: ${response.status}`); } return response.json(); }...

documents.title: Python
documents.content: from fastapi import FastAPI, HTTPException, Depends from pydantic import BaseModel from typing import List, Optional from datetime import datetime app = FastAPI() class RiskEntity(BaseModel): id: str name: str category: str severity: float created_at: datetime class RiskFilter(BaseModel): category: Optional[str] = None min_severity: float = 0.0 limit: int = 100 @app.get("/api/risks", response_model=List[RiskEntity]) async def get_risks( filters: RiskFilter = Depends(), db: Database =...

documents.title: SQL
documents.content: -- Calculate risk summary by category SELECT category, COUNT(*) as risk_count, AVG(severity) as avg_severity, MAX(severity) as max_severity, MIN(created_at) as oldest_risk, MAX(updated_at) as latest_update FROM risk_entities WHERE status = 'active' AND created_at >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '90 days' GROUP BY category HAVING COUNT(*) > 5 ORDER BY avg_severity DESC; -- Find correlated risks WITH risk_connections AS ( SELECT r1.id as risk_a, r2.id as risk_b, COUNT(*) as shared_controls FROM...

documents.title: JSON
documents.content: { "model": { "id": "urn:nfr:model:monte-carlo-v4", "version": "4.2.1", "type": "simulation" }, "parameters": { "iterations": 100000, "confidence_levels": [0.95, 0.99, 0.999], "distribution": { "type": "generalized_pareto", "shape": 0.5, "scale": 1000000 } }, "output": { "metrics": ["var", "es", "expected_loss"], "format": "json", "precision": 2 } }

documents.title: Bash / Shell
documents.content: #!/bin/bash set -euo pipefail # Configuration ENVIRONMENT=${1:-staging} VERSION=$(git describe --tags --always) REGISTRY="registry.example.com/nfr-connect" echo "Deploying version $VERSION to $ENVIRONMENT..." # Build and push images docker build -t "$REGISTRY/api:$VERSION" ./server docker build -t "$REGISTRY/client:$VERSION" ./client docker push "$REGISTRY/api:$VERSION" docker push "$REGISTRY/client:$VERSION" # Deploy to Kubernetes kubectl config use-context "$ENVIRONMENT" kubectl set image...

documents.title: Line Highlighting
documents.content: You can highlight specific lines: function calculateRisk(events: RiskEvent[]): number { let totalRisk = 0; // highlight-start for (const event of events) { totalRisk += event.severity * event.probability; } // highlight-end // Normalize to 0-100 scale return Math.min(totalRisk / events.length * 20, 100); }

documents.title: Diff Syntax
documents.content: - const oldConfig = { timeout: 5000 }; + const newConfig = { timeout: 10000, retries: 3 }; function fetchData(url) { - return fetch(url, oldConfig); + return fetch(url, newConfig); } :::tip Copy Button All code blocks include a copy button in the top-right corner. Click it to copy the code to your clipboard. :::

documents.title: Stress Testing
documents.content: Configure and run stress test scenarios

documents.title: Stress Testing
documents.content: NFR Connect provides comprehensive stress testing capabilities for assessing risk resilience under adverse conditions.

documents.title: Scenario Types
documents.content: Type Description Use Case Historical Based on actual past events Market crash, pandemic Hypothetical Custom adverse scenarios Cyber attack, system failure Reverse Find breaking points Capital adequacy testing

documents.title: Define a Scenario
documents.content: { "name": "Market Stress Q4 2024", "type": "hypothetical", "parameters": { "market_shock": -0.25, "volatility_multiplier": 2.5, "correlation_breakdown": true }, "duration_days": 30 }

documents.title: Execute via API
documents.content: const result = await fetch('/api/stress-tests/execute', { method: 'POST', body: JSON.stringify({ scenario_id: 'market-stress-q4-2024', portfolios: ['trading', 'banking-book'], output_format: 'detailed' }) });

documents.title: Results Analysis
documents.content: Stress test results include: P&L Impact: Projected profit/loss under stress Capital Impact: Effect on regulatory capital ratios Liquidity Impact: Cash flow stress analysis Operational Impact: Process and system resilience :::info Regulatory Compliance Stress testing results are automatically formatted for regulatory submissions including CCAR, DFAST, and EBA requirements. :::

documents.title: Scenario Analysis
documents.content: Multi-factor scenario analysis and what-if modeling

documents.title: Scenario Analysis
documents.content: Scenario analysis enables exploration of risk outcomes under different assumptions and conditions.

documents.title: Multi-Factor Scenarios
documents.content: NFR Connect supports complex scenarios with multiple interacting factors: flowchart LR subgraph Inputs A[Economic Factors] B[Market Conditions] C[Operational State] end subgraph Model D[Scenario Engine] end subgraph Outputs E[Risk Metrics] F[Capital Impact] G[Action Items] end A --> D B --> D C --> D D --> E D --> F D --> G

documents.title: Scenario Definition
documents.content: scenario: name: "Rate Shock + Ops Failure" factors: - type: market parameter: interest_rate shock: +200bps - type: operational parameter: system_availability shock: -50% correlation_matrix: - [1.0, 0.3] - [0.3, 1.0]

documents.title: What-If Analysis
documents.content: The what-if analysis tool allows real-time exploration: Parameter Range Step Interest Rate -100 to +300 bps 25 bps FX Volatility 0.5x to 3.0x 0.25x Credit Spread 0 to +500 bps 50 bps :::tip Interactive Mode Use the Dashboard's interactive scenario builder for real-time what-if analysis with instant visual feedback. :::

documents.title: Risk Model Integration
documents.content: Integrate external risk calculation models with NFR Connect

documents.title: Risk Model Integration
documents.content: Learn how to programmatically integrate external risk calculation models with the NFR Connect ingestion engine using the standardized model definition schema. :::warning Deprecation Notice The schema will be deprecated on Dec 31, 2024. Please migrate to schema for all new integrations. :::

documents.title: Overview
documents.content: The integration process allows risk quant teams to push model outputs directly into the central operational risk database. This ensures that all Capital at Risk (CaR) calculations are synchronized across the dashboard in real-time. Models are identified by a unique URN and must be registered in the Model Inventory before data ingestion can occur. :::info Prerequisites API Token with scope Whitelisted IP address for the sourcing server :::

documents.title: Configuration Object
documents.content: The configuration object defines the model's metadata and expected input parameters. { "modelId": "urn:ubs:nfr:model:monte-carlo-oprisk-v4", "version": "2.1.0", "owner": "Group Risk Analytics", "parameters": [ { "name": "iterations", "type": "integer", "default": 10000, "description": "Number of simulation cycles" }, { "name": "confidence_interval", "type": "float", "default": 0.999 } ] }

documents.title: Field Definitions
documents.content: Field Type Description string The unique URN (Uniform Resource Name) assigned by the model governance committee string Semantic version following SemVer 2.0 specification string The business unit responsible for model maintenance array List of configurable input parameters float Statistical confidence level for the VaR calculation. Must be between 0.90 and 0.9999

documents.title: Registration Workflow
documents.content: flowchart TD A[Submit Model Schema] --> B{Validation} B -->|Pass| C[Generate URN] B -->|Fail| D[Return Errors] C --> E[Register in Inventory] E --> F[Enable Ingestion Endpoint] F --> G[Model Ready]

documents.title: Register a Model
documents.content: const response = await fetch('/api/models/register', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Authorization': `Bearer ${token}`, 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify({ modelId: 'urn:ubs:nfr:model:my-custom-model', version: '1.0.0', owner: 'Risk Analytics Team', schema: modelSchema }) });

documents.title: Push Model Output
documents.content: import httpx async def push_model_results(model_id: str, results: dict): async with httpx.AsyncClient() as client: response = await client.post( f"/api/models/{model_id}/results", json={ "timestamp": datetime.utcnow().isoformat(), "outputs": results, "metadata": { "run_id": str(uuid4()), "environment": "production" } }, headers={"Authorization": f"Bearer {token}"} ) return response.json()

documents.title: Model Output Schema
documents.content: All model outputs must conform to the standard output schema: { "$schema": "https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/schema", "type": "object", "required": ["var", "expected_loss", "tail_risk"], "properties": { "var": { "type": "number", "description": "Value at Risk at specified confidence" }, "expected_loss": { "type": "number", "description": "Expected loss amount" }, "tail_risk": { "type": "number", "description": "Expected shortfall / CVaR" } } } :::tip Best Practices Always include a for...

documents.title: Monte Carlo Simulations
documents.content: Probabilistic risk modeling with Monte Carlo methods

documents.title: Monte Carlo Simulations
documents.content: Monte Carlo simulations provide probabilistic estimates of risk metrics through repeated random sampling.

documents.title: Methodology
documents.content: The Monte Carlo approach generates thousands of possible outcomes to estimate the distribution of risk: $$ \hat{\mu} = \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^{N} f(X_i) $$ Where: $\hat{\mu}$ is the estimated mean outcome $N$ is the number of simulation iterations $f(X_i)$ is the outcome function for sample $i$

documents.title: Simulation Parameters
documents.content: Parameter Default Range Description 10,000 1,000 - 1,000,000 Number of simulation runs 99.9% 95% - 99.99% VaR confidence level random any integer Random seed for reproducibility normal normal, t, empirical Loss distribution type

documents.title: Configuration Example
documents.content: { "model": "urn:ubs:nfr:model:mc-oprisk", "parameters": { "iterations": 100000, "confidence_levels": [0.95, 0.99, 0.999], "distribution": { "type": "generalized_pareto", "params": { "shape": 0.5, "scale": 1000000 } }, "correlation_method": "gaussian_copula" } }

documents.title: Output Metrics
documents.content: The simulation produces: pie title Loss Distribution Percentiles "0-95th percentile" : 950 "95th-99th percentile" : 40 "99th-99.9th percentile" : 9 "Beyond 99.9th" : 1

documents.title: Key Outputs
documents.content: Metric Formula Description VaR $VaR_\alpha = F^{-1}(\alpha)$ Value at Risk at confidence α ES $ES_\alpha = E[L | L > VaR_\alpha]$ Expected Shortfall (CVaR) Std Dev $\sigma = \sqrt{Var(L)}$ Loss volatility

documents.title: Performance Optimization
documents.content: For large-scale simulations: Parallel Processing: Utilize multi-core execution Variance Reduction: Apply antithetic variates GPU Acceleration: Enable CUDA for matrix operations :::warning Computation Time Simulations with >100,000 iterations may take several minutes. Use the async API for long-running jobs. ::: # Submit async job job = await client.post('/api/simulations/submit', json=config) job_id = job['id'] # Poll for completion while True: status = await...

documents.title: Introduction
documents.content: Welcome to NFR Connect Documentation

documents.title: Introduction to NFR Connect
documents.content: Welcome to NFR Connect - your comprehensive platform for Non-Financial Risk intelligence and management. :::info Prerequisites This documentation is publicly available and does not require authentication. For access to the Dashboard and Chat features, please sign in to the main application. :::

documents.title: What is NFR Connect?
documents.content: NFR Connect is an enterprise-grade platform designed to transform how organizations identify, assess, and manage non-financial risks. Built on cutting-edge AI and graph technologies, it provides: Agentic Reasoning - Autonomous LLM agents that reason over complex unstructured data to identify emerging risks Graph Visualization - Interactive knowledge graphs revealing hidden relationships and risk propagation paths Automated Taxonomy - DICE model for intelligent control-to-risk mapping Real-time...

documents.title: Platform Components
documents.content: Component Description Access Dashboard Visual analytics and KPI monitoring Requires authentication Chat Agentic AI assistant for risk queries Requires authentication Glossary NFR terminology and definitions Requires authentication Documentation Technical guides and API reference Public

documents.title: Quick Links
documents.content: Installation Guide - Set up your development environment Authentication - Configure Azure AD integration Risk Model Integration - Connect external risk models API Reference - Complete API documentation

documents.title: Installation
documents.content: Set up your NFR Connect development environment

documents.title: Installation
documents.content: This guide walks you through setting up NFR Connect for local development.

documents.title: System Requirements
documents.content: Requirement Minimum Version Node.js 18.0 or higher Python 3.12 or higher npm 9.0 or higher

documents.title: 1. Clone the Repository
documents.content: git clone https://github.com/ubs/nfr-connect.git cd nfr-connect

documents.title: 2. Install Client Dependencies
documents.content: cd client npm install

documents.title: 3. Install Server Dependencies
documents.content: cd ../server pip install -r requirements.txt

documents.title: 4. Configure Environment Variables
documents.content: Create files in both and directories: REACT_APP_CLIENT_ID=your-azure-client-id REACT_APP_AUTHORITY=https://login.microsoftonline.com/your-tenant-id REACT_APP_REDIRECT_URI=http://localhost:3000 REACT_APP_API_BASE_URL=http://localhost:8000 REACT_APP_LOGIN_SCOPES=User.Read REACT_APP_API_SCOPES=api://your-api-scope/access_as_user TENANT_ID=your-tenant-id CLIENT_ID=your-client-id CLIENT_SECRET=your-client-secret GRAPH_SCOPES=User.Read,GroupMember.Read.All :::tip Azure AD Setup Contact your Azure...

documents.title: 5. Start Development Servers
documents.content: # Start the backend server cd server uvicorn main:app --reload --port 8000 # In a new terminal, start the frontend cd client npm start The application will be available at .

documents.title: Verify Installation
documents.content: After starting both servers, you should be able to: Access the home page at See the Microsoft Sign In button View the documentation at :::info Troubleshooting If you encounter CORS errors, ensure both servers are running and the in the server includes . :::

documents.title: Authentication
documents.content: Configure Azure AD authentication for NFR Connect

documents.title: Authentication
documents.content: NFR Connect uses Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) for secure enterprise authentication.

documents.title: Authentication Flow
documents.content: sequenceDiagram participant U as User participant C as Client App participant A as Azure AD participant S as Backend API participant G as Graph API U->>C: Click Sign In C->>A: Redirect to login A->>U: Present login form U->>A: Enter credentials A->>C: Return access token C->>S: API request + token S->>G: Validate & get groups G-->>S: User groups S-->>C: Access rights C-->>U: Authorized view

documents.title: Access Control
documents.content: NFR Connect implements role-based access control through Azure AD groups: Access Right Azure AD Group Features NFR-Chat-Users Agentic chat interface NFR-Dashboard-Users Analytics dashboard

documents.title: Client Configuration
documents.content: The authentication configuration is managed in : export const msalConfig = { auth: { clientId: process.env.REACT_APP_CLIENT_ID, authority: process.env.REACT_APP_AUTHORITY, redirectUri: process.env.REACT_APP_REDIRECT_URI, }, cache: { cacheLocation: 'sessionStorage', storeAuthStateInCookie: false, }, }; export const loginRequest = { scopes: ['User.Read'], };

documents.title: Server Configuration
documents.content: The backend validates tokens and checks group membership: @app.get("/api/auth/access") async def check_access(token: str = Depends(oauth2_scheme)): # Validate token and get user groups groups = await get_user_groups(token) return { "hasChatAccess": CHAT_GROUP_ID in groups, "hasDashboardAccess": DASHBOARD_GROUP_ID in groups, "user": get_user_display_name(token) }

documents.title: Troubleshooting
documents.content: :::warning Common Issues "AADSTS50011: The reply URL specified in the request does not match" Ensure matches the registered redirect URI in Azure AD "User is not authorized" Verify the user is a member of the required Azure AD groups Check that group IDs in server are correct :::

documents.title: Security Best Practices
documents.content: Never expose client secrets in frontend code Use secure token storage - NFR Connect uses sessionStorage Implement token refresh - Tokens are automatically refreshed before expiry Validate tokens server-side - All API requests are validated against Azure AD

documents.title: Risk Taxonomy
documents.content: Understanding the NFR Connect risk classification system

documents.title: Risk Taxonomy
documents.content: NFR Connect uses a hierarchical taxonomy to classify and organize non-financial risks across the enterprise.

documents.title: Taxonomy Structure
documents.content: The risk taxonomy follows a four-level hierarchy: Level 1: Risk Category └── Level 2: Risk Type └── Level 3: Risk Sub-type └── Level 4: Risk Event

documents.title: Risk Categories
documents.content: Category Code Description Operational Risk OPR Risks from failed internal processes, people, or systems Compliance Risk CMP Risks from regulatory non-compliance Strategic Risk STR Risks from business decisions and external factors Reputational Risk REP Risks to brand and stakeholder trust

documents.title: DICE Model Integration
documents.content: The DICE (Data Insights Clustering Enrichment) model automatically maps control failures to the appropriate taxonomy nodes: $$ P(\text{taxonomy}|\text{event}) = \frac{P(\text{event}|\text{taxonomy}) \cdot P(\text{taxonomy})}{P(\text{event})} $$ Where: $P(\text{taxonomy}|\text{event})$ is the probability of a taxonomy classification given an event $P(\text{event}|\text{taxonomy})$ is the likelihood of the event under that taxonomy $P(\text{taxonomy})$ is the prior probability of the taxonomy...

documents.title: Taxonomy API
documents.content: Query the risk taxonomy programmatically: const response = await fetch('/api/taxonomy/tree'); const taxonomy = await response.json(); // Response structure { "id": "OPR", "label": "Operational Risk", "children": [ { "id": "OPR-001", "label": "Process Risk", "children": [...] } ] }

documents.title: Related Documentation
documents.content: Event Types - Understanding risk event classification Impact Analysis - Assessing risk impact

documents.title: Impact Analysis
documents.content: Assessing and quantifying risk impact

documents.title: Impact Analysis
documents.content: Impact analysis in NFR Connect quantifies the potential consequences of risk events across multiple dimensions.

documents.title: Impact Dimensions
documents.content: Dimension Metrics Weight Financial Direct loss, remediation cost 40% Operational Service disruption, productivity 25% Regulatory Fines, sanctions, compliance gaps 20% Reputational Client impact, media exposure 15%

documents.title: Quantitative Assessment
documents.content: The total impact score is calculated as a weighted sum: $$ I_{total} = \sum_{i=1}^{n} w_i \cdot I_i $$ Where: $I_{total}$ is the total impact score $w_i$ is the weight for dimension $i$ $I_i$ is the impact score for dimension $i$ (1-5 scale)

documents.title: Example Calculation
documents.content: For a data breach event: Dimension Score Weight Weighted Financial 4 0.40 1.60 Operational 3 0.25 0.75 Regulatory 5 0.20 1.00 Reputational 4 0.15 0.60 Total 3.95

documents.title: Impact Propagation
documents.content: NFR Connect uses graph analysis to identify cascading impacts: flowchart LR A[Primary Event] --> B[Control Failure] B --> C[System Outage] B --> D[Data Loss] C --> E[Client Impact] D --> E E --> F[Regulatory Reporting] :::info HALO Model The HALO (Hypergraph Analysis of Linked Objects) model identifies multi-hop risk propagation paths, revealing hidden dependencies and systemic risks. :::

documents.title: Capital at Risk (CaR)
documents.content: For significant events, NFR Connect calculates the Capital at Risk: $$ CaR = VaR_{99.9%} \times \sqrt{\frac{t}{252}} $$ Where: $VaR_{99.9%}$ is the Value at Risk at 99.9% confidence $t$ is the time horizon in days 252 is the number of trading days per year This metric is used for regulatory capital allocation and stress testing scenarios.

documents.title: Event Types
documents.content: Classification of risk events in NFR Connect

documents.title: Event Types
documents.content: Risk events in NFR Connect are classified by type to enable consistent analysis and reporting.

documents.title: Event Classification
documents.content: Type Description Example Loss Event Actual financial or operational loss Trading error resulting in $50K loss Near Miss Potential loss that was avoided Failed backup detected before data loss Control Failure Breakdown in control effectiveness Unauthorized access attempt blocked External Event External factor impacting operations Vendor service outage

documents.title: Event Lifecycle
documents.content: stateDiagram-v2 [*] --> Detected: Event Identified Detected --> Assessed: Initial Review Assessed --> InProgress: Action Required Assessed --> Closed: No Action Needed InProgress --> Remediated: Controls Updated Remediated --> Verified: Testing Complete Verified --> Closed: Resolution Confirmed Closed --> [*]

documents.title: Event Severity Matrix
documents.content: Events are scored based on impact and likelihood: Likelihood / Impact Low (1-2) Medium (3-4) High (5) Rare Low Low Medium Unlikely Low Medium Medium Possible Medium Medium High Likely Medium High High Almost Certain High High Critical :::warning Severity Escalation Events classified as High or Critical trigger automatic escalation to the Risk Committee and require remediation within 48 hours. :::

documents.title: Event Ingestion
documents.content: Events can be ingested through multiple channels: Manual Entry - Through the NFR Connect Dashboard API Integration - Programmatic submission via REST API Automated Detection - From monitoring systems and log analysis { "type": "LOSS_EVENT", "severity": 3, "description": "Unauthorized transaction processed", "taxonomy_code": "OPR-002-001", "detected_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z", "business_unit": "Trading Operations" }

documents.title: Rate Limits
documents.content: API rate limiting and quotas

documents.title: Rate Limits
documents.content: NFR Connect implements rate limiting to ensure fair usage and system stability.

documents.title: Limits by Tier
documents.content: Tier Requests/Minute Requests/Day Concurrent Standard 60 10,000 5 Professional 300 100,000 20 Enterprise 1,000 Unlimited 100

documents.title: Rate Limit Headers
documents.content: All API responses include rate limit information: HTTP/1.1 200 OK X-RateLimit-Limit: 60 X-RateLimit-Remaining: 45 X-RateLimit-Reset: 1704067200 Header Description Maximum requests per window Requests remaining in window Unix timestamp when window resets

documents.title: Handling Rate Limits
documents.content: When rate limited, you'll receive a response: { "error": "rate_limit_exceeded", "message": "Too many requests. Please retry after 30 seconds.", "retry_after": 30 }

documents.title: Best Practices
documents.content: Implement exponential backoff for retries Cache responses where appropriate Use webhooks for real-time updates instead of polling Batch requests when possible async function fetchWithRetry(url: string, maxRetries = 3) { for (let i = 0; i < maxRetries; i++) { const response = await fetch(url); if (response.status === 429) { const retryAfter = response.headers.get('Retry-After') || Math.pow(2, i); await sleep(retryAfter * 1000); continue; } return response; } throw new Error('Max retries...

documents.title: Error Codes
documents.content: API error codes and troubleshooting

documents.title: Error Codes
documents.content: NFR Connect uses standard HTTP status codes along with detailed error responses.

documents.title: Error Response Format
documents.content: All errors follow a consistent structure: { "error": { "code": "VALIDATION_ERROR", "message": "Invalid request parameters", "details": [ { "field": "severity", "message": "Must be between 1 and 5" } ], "request_id": "req-abc123" } }

documents.title: Authentication Errors (401)
documents.content: Code Description Resolution Token is malformed or expired Obtain a new token Token has expired Refresh the token No authorization header Include Bearer token

documents.title: Authorization Errors (403)
documents.content: Code Description Resolution Token lacks required scope Request appropriate scopes User lacks permission Contact administrator IP address not allowed Add IP to whitelist

documents.title: Validation Errors (400)
documents.content: Code Description Resolution Request body validation failed Check array Query parameter invalid Review parameter format Required field missing Include all required fields

documents.title: Resource Errors (404/409)
documents.content: Code Description Resolution Resource does not exist Verify resource ID Resource already exists Use update endpoint State conflict Retry with fresh data

documents.title: Server Errors (500)
documents.content: Code Description Resolution Unexpected server error Retry with exponential backoff Temporary outage Check status page Database operation failed Retry later

documents.title: Common Issues
documents.content: :::info Request ID Always include the from error responses when contacting support - it helps us trace the exact issue. ::: "Token expired" immediately after login Check that your system clock is synchronized Ensure the token issuer time is correct "Insufficient scope" with valid token Review the scopes requested during authentication Some endpoints require additional scopes like Intermittent 500 errors Implement retry logic with exponential backoff Check the status page for ongoing incidents

documents.title: API Endpoints
documents.content: Complete NFR Connect API reference

documents.title: API Endpoints
documents.content: NFR Connect exposes a RESTful API for programmatic integration. All endpoints require authentication unless otherwise noted.

documents.title: Base URL
documents.content: Production: https://api.nfr-connect.example.com/v1 Development: http://localhost:8000/api

documents.title: Authentication
documents.content: All requests must include a valid Bearer token: curl -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" https://api.nfr-connect.example.com/v1/risks

documents.title: Check User Access
documents.content: GET /api/auth/access Returns the current user's access rights. Response: { "hasChatAccess": true, "hasDashboardAccess": true, "user": "John Doe" }

documents.title: List Risk Events
documents.content: GET /api/risks Query Parameters: Parameter Type Description string Filter by status (active, closed, all) integer Minimum severity level (1-5) datetime Start date (ISO 8601) datetime End date (ISO 8601) integer Max results (default: 100) integer Pagination offset Response: { "data": [ { "id": "evt-12345", "type": "LOSS_EVENT", "severity": 3, "description": "Unauthorized transaction", "status": "active", "created_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z" } ], "total": 142, "limit": 100, "offset": 0 }

documents.title: Create Risk Event
documents.content: POST /api/risks Request Body: { "type": "LOSS_EVENT", "severity": 3, "description": "Description of the event", "taxonomy_code": "OPR-002-001", "business_unit": "Trading Operations" }

documents.title: List Registered Models
documents.content: GET /api/models

documents.title: Register Model
documents.content: POST /api/models/register

documents.title: Push Model Results
documents.content: POST /api/models/{model_id}/results

documents.title: Submit Simulation Job
documents.content: POST /api/simulations/submit

documents.title: Get Simulation Status
documents.content: GET /api/simulations/{job_id}/status

documents.title: Get Simulation Results
documents.content: GET /api/simulations/{job_id}/results

documents.title: Response Codes
documents.content: Code Description 200 Success 201 Created 400 Bad Request - Invalid parameters 401 Unauthorized - Invalid or missing token 403 Forbidden - Insufficient permissions 404 Not Found 429 Too Many Requests - Rate limit exceeded 500 Internal Server Error :::tip SDK Available For Python and TypeScript integrations, consider using our official SDKs which handle authentication and error handling automatically. :::
